duties_responsibilities.duty: Design and characterization of prototype equipment and pilot processes in support of manufacturing scale-up and launch.
Manage internal and external resources in the development of manual and semi-automated processes for product assembly.
Oversee the development of production and process control documents, and prepare technical analysis and recommend manufacturing methods and processes.

Apply lean manufacturing methodologies to characterize, debug, and optimize manufacturing processes. Support Design for Manufacturing/Assembly (DFM/A) activities and process specification definition throughout product development lifecycle.
Support root cause investigations, manufacturing process improvements, and design reviews, FMEA’s, risk/hazard analysis & establishing technical requirements.
Support identification and qualification of suppliers for specialty materials, finished goods, and equipment. Support 3D modeling and tolerance analysis of complex electro-mechanical systems.
Work with globally located and cross-functional teams at the business unit and plant level to achieve project goals. Approximately 10 – 25% travel is expected.

Responsible for the coordination of the test method development as an R&D liaison for design transfer; deliver DFM analysis, develop manufacturing process specifications, and support first-of-type semi and fully automated manufacturing equipment.

education_certification.credential: B.S. degree in Mechanical, Biomedical, or related Engineering discipline is required. (Masters' degree or MBA preferred)
